justification: The authors state: “We measured psychological wellbeing ("happiness") …” indicating that a direct happiness item was used to operationalize wellbeing.

measured_by: survey item assessing overall threat of COVID-19
justification: The methods section lists “risk perception (overall threat …)” as one of the variables that was measured with specific survey questions.

measured_by: survey item assessing probability of contracting COVID-19
justification: Risk perception was decomposed into “probability of infection,” showing that a dedicated probability item served as the measure of this construct.

measured_by: survey item assessing severity of consequences if infected
justification: The paper specifies that risk perception included the “consequence of COVID-19 infection,” implying a survey item capturing perceived severity.

measured_by: self-reported frequency of facemask use, staying at home, social distancing, handwashing items
justification: The authors note they measured “engagement in preventative behaviours (such as facemask use, staying at home, social distancing, washing hands, etc.),” revealing the item set used to quantify this construct.

measured_by: self-reported frequency of activities such as dining indoors, social gatherings, shopping, traveling items
justification: They report measuring “daily activities (such as dining indoors, social gatherings, meeting strangers, … traveling etc.)” indicating these activity-frequency items operationalize the construct of daily socioeconomic activity.
